name: Dunheanish Guest House

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights with my parents. We had travelled around Scotland and this was our last stop. Upon our arrival I think my parents almost had a heart attack at the location of the B&B as it is a fair way up a steep hill and they are in their 70s. However, we found the B&B to be excellent in every aspect. So uch so that we forgot about the hill! The rooms are spacious and well presented, breakfast was freshly cooked by William. William is a super host too, ensuring that all of us were tended to and we got the best out of our stay in Oban.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My parents did end up getting a taxi home when we walked to Oban seafront, but they did not mind this and were very very impressed by the views and service we all received.
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Oban,having stayed with William and Linda at the Dunheanish. The standard of cleanliness and friendliness was overwhelming,our room on the front of the hotel offered magnificent views over Oban bay and Mull.We could not have been made more welcome and will certainly return.As for the person who damaged the car,I suggest you learn to drive,we didnt have a problem!!!!
reviews.title: A very warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely guest house. It's a large converted Victorian house so the bathrooms are, as some people have said, compact but spotless. The rooms are traditionally decorated (but not twee) with 4 poster beds etc. When booking you can request certain rooms to be reserved, these are the ones at the fromt (I think a little more expensive), but the views are spectacular.
reviews.title: A Great find with amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: William met us on arrival and was incredibly helpful. Breakfast was good too. Overall a lovely guesthouse (but maybe not so good if you are elderly/infirm as it is quite a steep climb up from the high street in Oban, but the views are definately worth it!
reviews.title: Elegant and welcoming guest house.
Another lovely stay at the Dunheanish
reviews.text: We have stayed in the Dunheanish before and were delighted with our room - number 1- and the friendly welcome extended to us by William and Linda. I am delighted to say that nothing has changed . We stayed in the same room and William, Linda and the views were just as we remembered them! This is a lovely Ban B with a great breakfast and clean and comfortable rooms. William and Linda always take an interest in what you are doing and where you have eaten and are always ready to add their own recommendations. We will be back again - perhaps we might even get to stay in the elusive room 4 - it is always booked when we want to go!

reviews.title: Absolutely marvellous
reviews.text: We stayed here for only two nights - my husband and I plus my elderly parents. This is one of the nicest places we stayed in two weeks in Scotland.

reviews.title: Great views but the guest house was nothing out of the ordinary
reviews.text: I don't think I can say much about the accommodations other than what you see on the B&B's website is accurate. The place is gorgeous, the rooms are spacious and spotless, breakfasts were tasty, and the host was fantastic. This B&B definitely deserves the great rating that it is getting on the Trip Advisor website.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: My mother - well into her 'of a certain age' - managed to trip over something two days before leaving for Scotland, so she arrived with a lame knee. Even so, she managed the stairway from the street up to the B&B without much trouble, and that was with a small piece of luggage. We moved our car to the small car park (which will hold 3 cars if they are parked correctly), but other guests who left their car at street level said that they had no problems with that arrangement.

reviews.title: Beautiful view of the city.
reviews.text: There is a pedestrian path to the downtown area, and a good choice of restaurants and the ferry terminal (for Mull) are a fifteen minute walk away. Going down isn't too bad. If the steepness of the walk bothers you, taxis are available to take you back to the B&B (there is a taxi stand downtown).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great view yes, but beware of the car park. I damaged my car on the wall and I see from the reviews that others have also damaged there vehicles.
reviews.title: Beware of The Car Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nothing special and we did not have a good view from our room. The shower room was cold and the breakfast was nothing special. I also found the walk back from the town hard as a big hill to climb and then steps to the house. I would not come again or tell my friends about it.i
reviews.title: Best B&B ever

reviews.text: This is the nicest B&B we have ever found. Our room was massive, well appointed and with views to die for across Oban Bay towards Kerrera and Mull. William, the owner, was friendly and helpful and cooked a great breakfast (or was that his partner...|). If I had to nitpick, it would be on two points - the room COULD have been a little warmer - it's a big room, and even two radiators failed to make it cosy. Secondly, the bathroom, although perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean, was no more than that, and such a lovely room really deserved a more generously sized bathroom, preferably with a bath to warm your bones after a cold day out. This guesthouse is also very well situated for exploring both Oban and the surrounding countryside.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: We had a fantastic welcome when we arrived at Dunheanish on a wet Friday afternoon. The house is completely spotless and has an amazing view of Oban - we were in Room 5 and my Mum in Room 6. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were warm. Can't fault our stay - even if it was for one night. The walk back up the hill from town is not as strenuous as you may think if you take the short cut.
reviews.title: superb

reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely - try the smoked salmon and scrambled eggs if salmon is your thing. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great view, stunning rooms and entertaining host!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed 2 nights at Dunheanish in September and had a great time. Our room (room 4) was very spacious and comfortable with a fantastic view over Oban and out towards Mull. Breakfasts were generous and freshly cooked and William was a most welcoming host. Only potential downsides are the limited off road parking and steep entrance if, like us, you suffer with bad knees but overall we would thoroughly recommend Dunheanish and very much like to return.
reviews.title: Great service and fabulous view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the Dunheanish for the first two nights of our honeymoon, and were very impressed with the experience. The owners are extremely helpful and courteous, our room was lovely and the breakfast was delicious. We had a beautiful view out over the harbor from our room (Room 1). We also thought the price was very reasonable for such a high quality place. We would recommend the Dunheanish to anyone, and will definitely stay there again the next time we're in Oban.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at Dunheanish before taking the ferry to Isle of Mull. William was a very friendly host who helped us with directions and with choosing a place for dinner. We went to Cuan Mor which was lovely. Our room was beautiful and we had everything we needed. Breakfast was huge and delicious... I could not finish I was so full. The walk down the the harbour front was very very steep so be sure to bring good walking shoes.
reviews.title: Very friendly B&B in Oban near ferries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here en route to Mull and were extremely impressed with all aspects of our stay. We booked into room 5 which overlooks the harbour in Oban and were treated to a well sized, very clean and well looked after room. William could not have been more helpful during our stay - a really pleasant and decent chap who made sure we were happy with everything but was in no way overbearing.
reviews.title: Great location and amazing service from William

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an early ferry to catch the following morning and had a great cooked breakfast in the dining room on the ground floor before we left.
reviews.title: A gem overlooking the bay

description: William and Linda would like to welcome you to Dunheanish Guest House, one of Oban's newest guest houses, an elegant detached Victorian villa beside Oban's landmark, McCaig’s Tower with stunning panoramic views overlooking Oban Bay and the surrounding islands of Kerrera, Lismore and Mull. Dunheanish is the perfect base for anyone who wants to have the town center 5 mins away, with easy access to shops, restaurants and the Caledonian MacBrayne ferry terminal.
